Description: Brass lamp: open, elongated triangular body, with high vertical sides, the rear, short, side rising to a gable-like shape to support the ring-handle, which has angular projections on its upper and lower sides. Flat base. Surface colouration: patchy light and dark green.
Curator's comments: Compare Bénazeth, D., 1992. ‘L'art du métal au début de l'ère chrétienne’. Paris : Eds. de la Réunion des musées nationaux, p. 132, E 11695, which is very similar to ours but has a hinged lid.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (3837)
